text.section:
Each public institution of higher education may honor credit cards as payment for:
Tuition and fees;
Room and board; and
Any goods or services purchased from other auxiliary enterprises.

The governing boards of the institutions shall determine which credit cards are acceptable for this purpose. However, a public institution may not accept a credit card from any credit card company which charges that institution a vendor discount, service charge or similar fee in excess of 2.5 percent.
